title: Neil Patrick Harris undergoes hand surgery after tendon he injured on Croatian getaway was infected
text:
Neil Patrick Harris is recovering after undergoing surgery on his hand Tuesday.

The How I Met Your Mother actor, 46, took to Instagram with a series of shots from the procedure at the Manhattan Eye Ear & Throat Hospital.

He was pictured in a series of shots wearing a medical gown; looking at an ultrasound; and having the troublesome limb propped up while recuperating.

On the mend: Neil Patrick Harris, 46, is recovering after undergoing surgery on his hand Tuesday. The How I Met Your Mother actor took to Instagram with a series of shots from the procedure at the Manhattan Eye Ear & Throat Hospital

The actor, 46, wrote he 'had surgery today' following a European getaway with husband David Burtka and their twins Gideon and Harper, nine.

'I tripped and hand planted onto a sea urchin almost two months ago while climbing rocky cliffs in Croatia,' Harris wrote, delving into the details of what happened.

'Most of the tiny spines I dug out myself, but two refused to leave and one got infected,' he said, adding that it 'turns out it pierced through a tendon.'

Harris credited Dr. Dan Polatsch and his team for their work on his hurt hand.

Getting better: The star had the troublesome limb propped up while recuperating after the procedure

Damage: Harris had a tendon infection following the overseas incident

'I’m officially urchin free and on the mend,' Harris said. 'Only drawback - having to wear this massive hand elevating contraption for the foreseeable future ... all in all, though, I have to say: uni is still delicious.'

The procedure on Harris came on the day his casting in the new Matrix film was announced.

Harris will appear in the fourth installment of the sci-fi franchise alongside stalwarts Keanu Reeves and Carrie-Anne Moss, according to Variety.

Actor Yahya Abdul-Mateen II has also been confirmed for the movie, which production is set to commence on next year.
